channel.title: Vps
channel.description:
can you explain more about a VPS for me (what it does, what is it, etc etc)
Also, where can i buy one and how would i use it on my server?
Elliot

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

VPS stands for Virtual Private Server. Basically to me it’s like another computer, your connecting to a Server line dedicated to that IP. Most Virtual Private Server’s will have 99.9% uptime and is normally used for business uses.

You can buy VPSs nearly everywhere you look over the net, but I strongly suggest vpsland.com- as it’s cheap and quite effcient.

To “use” it on your Server you’ll need to upload your Server download it from the VPS use a program that allows you to hide your Ip, I use NO-IP DUC although it is horrible and portforward on your computer, you should be able to login.

You can keep your Server running 24/7 and shutdown your computer.

Read full topic
